tool.name: Madtool

param.name: in_raster
param.dialogReference: the input raster being it a DEM or an image (e.g., satellite imagery)

tool.summary:
This tool calculates 3 basic short-range (lag 2 pixels) roughness indexes; the detrending is performed automatically using a moving mean with a circular search window with radius of 3 pixels, the same search window used for calculating the indices:

- isotropic roughness(same units as input)

- anisotropy in roughness(dimensionless)

- anisotropy direction(degrees in geographical system)

It also furnishes the residual surface (dtm-trend)and the trend (the smoothed version of the input raster).

For exploiting the potential of geostatistical-based roughness indices use the source code ...and your creativity! This tool it is only intended as a first glance of this methodology and to furnisha quick yetinformative and robust roughness index.Moreover, in some circumstances you could use classical geostatistical indices (e.g., variogram and madogram) , that are computed faster.
tool.usage: Simply give at the tool the input DTM/image; the outputs (the names are self-evident) will be savedin your current workspace(so take care to define itcorrectly).
